Q9ZTC3 Transcription factor MYB90; Myb-related protein 90; AtMYB90; Production of anthocyanin pigment 2 protein from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (100% identity, 100% coverage)
NP_176813 myb domain protein 90 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT1G66390 MYB90 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 90); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription activator, when associated with BHLH12/MYC1, EGL3, or GL3. Promotes the synthesis of phenylpropanoid-derived compounds such as anthocyanins.
    SUBUNIT: Interacts with BHLH12/MYC1, BHLH1/GL3/MYC6, BHLH2/EGL3/MYC146, and BHLH42/TT8.

  • Light and the E3 ubiquitin ligase COP1/SPA control the protein stability of the MYB transcription factors PAP1 and PAP2 involved in anthocyanin accumulation in Arabidopsis.
    Maier, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: The COP1/SPA complex affects PAP1 and PAP2 both transcriptionally and post-translationally. The COP1/SPA complex controls anthocyanin levels in Arabidopsis.
  • An autoregulatory feedback loop involving PAP1 and TAS4 in response to sugars in Arabidopsis.
    Luo, Plant molecular biology 2012
    • GeneRIF: Data indicate that miR828, TAS4-siRNA81(-), and its targets MYB transcription factors PAP1 and PAP2 are responsive to sucrose.
  • Transgene silencing and transgene-derived siRNA production in tobacco plants homozygous for an introduced AtMYB90 construct.
    Velten, PloS one 2012
    • GeneRIF: The observed reduction in anthocyanin pigmentation and AtMYB90 mRNA was phenotypically identical to the patterns seen in leaves systemically silenced for the AtMYB90 transgene.
  • A spontaneous dominant-negative mutation within a 35S::AtMYB90 transgene inhibits flower pigment production in tobacco.
    Velten, PloS one 2010
    • GeneRIF: the mutant myb transgene product from Arabidopsis acts as a competitive inhibitor of the native tobacco NtAN2 protein

Q9FE25 Transcription factor MYB75; Myb-related protein 75; AtMYB75; Production of anthocyanin pigment 1 protein; Suc-induced anthocyanin accumulation locus 1 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (79% identity, 100% coverage)
NP_176057 production of anthocyanin pigment 1 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT1G56650 PAP1 (PRODUCTION OF ANTHOCYANIN PIGMENT 1); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription activator, when associated with BHLH12/MYC1, EGL3, or GL3. Promotes the synthesis of. phenylpropanoid-derived compounds such as anthocyanins and proanthocyanidin, probably together with GL3 and BHLH2. Regulates the expression of CHS, DFRA, LDOX, and BAN.
    SUBUNIT: Interacts with BHLH12/MYC1, BHLH1/GL3/MYC6, BHLH2/EGL3/MYC146, and BHLH42/TT8.
  • Petunia Ã hybrida floral scent production is negatively affected by high-temperature growth conditions.
    Cna'ani, Plant, cell & environment 2015 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: Flowers of 35S:PAP1 transgenic plants produced the same or even higher levels of volatiles when exposed to a long-term high-temperature regime.

  • Enhancement of oxidative and drought tolerance in Arabidopsis by overaccumulation of antioxidant flavonoids.
    Nakabayashi, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2014
    • GeneRIF: The quantity and diversity of flavonoids is increased by overexpressing MYB12/PAP1. Flavonoids enhances both biotic and abiotic stress tolerance in crops.
  • Arabidopsis AtPAP1 transcription factor induces anthocyanin production in transgenic Taraxacum brevicorniculatum.
    Qiu, Plant cell reports 2014 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: the production of anthocyanin pigment 1 (AtPAP1) transcription factor from Arabidopsis thaliana induces anthocyanin production in transgenic Taraxacum brevicorniculatum.[AtPAP1]
  • Modulation of flavonoid metabolites in Arabidopsis thaliana through overexpression of the MYB75 transcription factor: role of kaempferol-3,7-dirhamnoside in resistance to the specialist insect herbivore Pieris brassicae.
    Onkokesung, Journal of experimental botany 2014
    • GeneRIF: Performance of a specialist aphid (Brevicoryne brassicae) was unaffected after feeding on oxMYB75 plants, whereas a specialist caterpillar (Pieris brassicae) gained significantly higher body mass when feeding on this plant.
  • An apple MYB transcription factor, MdMYB3, is involved in regulation of anthocyanin biosynthesis and flower development

    Maier, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: The COP1/SPA complex affects PAP1 and PAP2 both transcriptionally and post-translationally. The COP1/SPA complex controls anthocyanin levels in Arabidopsis.

AT1G66370 MYB113 (myb domain protein 113); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana
MYB113, NP_176811 myb domain protein 113 from Arabidopsis thaliana

NP_001267854 MYB5b from Vitis vinifera (41% identity, 62% coverage)

  • A single amino acid change within the R2 domain of the VvMYB5b transcription factor modulates affinity for protein partners and target promoters selectivity.
    Hichri, BMC plant biology 2011
    • GeneRIF: The R69L mutation reduces VvMYB5b trans-activation capacity, and the protein no longer activates transcription of a flavonoid structural gene. The R69L substitution abolishes VvMYB5b interaction with VvMYC1.

Q9SEI0 Transcription factor WER; Myb-related protein 66; AtMYB66; Protein WEREWOLF from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (54% identity, 50% coverage)
NP_196979 myb domain protein 66 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT5G14750 ATMYB66 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 66); DNA binding / protein binding / transcription factor/ transcription regulator (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription activator, when associated with BHLH2/EGL3/MYC146 or BHLH12/MYC1. Involved in epidermal cell fate specification in roots and hypocotyl. Together with GL3 or BHLH2, promotes the formation of non-hair developing cells (atrichoblasts) et the N position in root epidermis. Regulates stomata spatial distribution in hypocotyls. Binds to the WER- binding sites (WBS) promoter regions and activates the transcription of target genes such as GL2 and of CPC.
    SUBUNIT: Interacts with GL3, BHLH2/EGL3/MYC146 and BHLH12/MYC1.
  • SABRE is required for stabilization of root hair patterning in Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Pietra, Physiologia plantarum 2015 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: Double mutant analysis reveal that wer and caprice (cpc) mutants, defective in core components of the epidermal patterning pathway, genetically interact with sab. This suggests that SAB may act on epidermal patterning upstream of WER and CPC.
  • Arabidopsis AIP1-2 restricted by WER-mediated patterning modulates planar polarity.
    Kiefer, Development (Cambridge, England) 2015
    • GeneRIF: AIP1-2, expressed under control of the WER-dependent patterning machinery and the ethylene signalling pathway, as a modulator of actin-mediated planar polarity.
  • WEREWOLF and ENHANCER of GLABRA3 are interdependent regulators of the spatial expression pattern of GLABRA2 in Arabidopsis.
    Song, Biochemical and biophysical research communications 2015 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: WER expressed ubiquitously in the root induced GL2 expression only in the root epidermis, whereas co-expression of WER and EGL3 induced GL2 expression in the corresponding tissues.
  • TORNADO1 regulates root epidermal patterning through the WEREWOLF pathway in Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Kwak, Plant signaling & behavior 2015
    • GeneRIF: TRN1 regulates the position-dependent cell fate determination by affecting WER expression in Arabidopsis root epidermis.
  • The promoter structure differentiation of a MYB transcription factor RLC1 causes red leaf coloration in Empire Red Leaf Cotton under light
    Gao, PloS one 2013
    • “...AtMYB90 (AAG42002), NtAN2 (ACO52470), CsRuby (AFB73909), AmROSEA2 (ABB83827), AmVENOSA1 (ABB83828), AtMYB90 (AAG42002), AtMYB113 (NP_176811), AtWER (NP_196979), AtMYB0 (NP_189430), GhMyb10 (CAD87010), MdMYB10 (ABB84753), MdMYB1 (ABK58136), PhAN2 (AAF66727), PhPHZ (ADW94951), PhDPL (ADW94950), VvMYBA1 (BAD18977), VvMYBA2 (BAD18978), and NtAN2 (ACO52470).   • Phosphatidic acid interacts with a MYB transcription factor and regulates its nuclear localization and function in Arabidopsis.
    Yao, The Plant cell 2013
    • GeneRIF: Phosphatidic acid interacts with werewolf (WER), a R2R3 MYB transcription factor involved in root hair formation.
  • Functional divergence of MYB-related genes, WEREWOLF and AtMYB23 in Arabidopsis.
    Tominaga-Wada, Bioscience, biotechnology, and biochemistry 2012 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: MYB23, WER, and MYB23-WER chimeric protein have similar functions in respect to root hair formation.
  • WEREWOLF, a regulator of root hair pattern formation, controls flowering time through the regulation of FT mRNA stability.
    Seo, Plant physiology 2011
    • GeneRIF: WER regulates not the transcription but the stability of FT mRNA.

Q9LTF7 Transcription factor MYB82; Myb-related protein 82; AtMYB82 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (61% identity, 45% coverage) (see paper)
AT5G52600 AtMYB82 (myb domain protein 82); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana
NP_680426 myb domain protein 82 from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription activation factor positively regulating trichomes development (PubMed:24803498). Has a function nearly equivalent to that of GL1 and can complement gl1 mutants (PubMed:24803498).
    SUBUNIT: Homodimer and heterodimer with GL1 (PubMed:24803498). Part of the WD40-bHLH-MYB complex (PubMed:24803498). Interacts with BHLH012/MYC1 and BHLH042/TT8 (PubMed:15361138). Interacts (via N-terminus) with GL1 and GL3 (PubMed:24803498).

  • MYB82 functions in regulation of trichome development in Arabidopsis.
    Liang, Journal of experimental botany 2014
    • GeneRIF: Protein interaction analysis revealed that MYB82 physically interacts with GLABRA3. In addition, MYB82 and GL1 can form homodimers and heterodimers at R2R3-MYB domains, which may explain why their overexpression reduces trichome numbers.

Q96276 Transcription factor MYB23; Myb-related protein 23; AtMYB23 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (58% identity, 44% coverage)
NP_198849 myb domain protein 23 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT5G40330 MYB23 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 23); DNA binding / protein binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription activator, when associated with BHLH2/EGL3/MYC146 or BHLH12/MYC1. Regulates the epidermal cell fate specification. Mediates the formation of columellae and accumulation of mucilages on seed coats. Controls the elongation of epidermal cells positively in roots but negatively in stems, leading to the promotion of primary roots elongation and repression of leaves and stems elongation, respectively. Ovoids ectopic root-hair formation, probably by inducing GL2 in roots. Controls trichome initiation and branching.
    SUBUNIT: Interacts with BHLH2/EGL3/MYC146, BHLH12/MYC1 and GL3.
  • Functional divergence of MYB-related genes, WEREWOLF and AtMYB23 in Arabidopsis.
    Tominaga-Wada, Bioscience, biotechnology, and biochemistry 2012 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: MYB23 acquired a specific function for trichome differentiation during evolution.
  • Quantitative expression analysis of selected transcription factors in pavement, basal and trichome cells of mature leaves from Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Schliep, Protoplasma 2010
    • GeneRIF: MYB23 showed a pattern of low expression in pavement cells, medium in basal cells and high expression in trichomes.
  • The MYB23 gene provides a positive feedback loop for cell fate specification in the Arabidopsis root epidermis.
    Kang, The Plant cell 2009
    • GeneRIF: MYB23 participates in a positive feedback loop to reinforce cell fate decisions and ensure robust establishment of the cell type pattern in the Arabidopsis root epidermis.
  • Molecular basis of natural variation and environmental control of trichome patterning
    Hauser, Frontiers in plant science 2014

Q9FJA2 Transcription factor TT2; Myb-related protein 123; AtMYB123; Myb-related transcription factor LBM2-like; Protein TRANSPARENT TESTA 2 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (64% identity, 40% coverage) (see paper)
AT5G35550 TT2 (TRANSPARENT TESTA 2); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana
NP_198405 Duplicated homeodomain-like superfamily protein from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription activator, when associated with BHLH2/EGL3/MYC146, BHLH12/MYC1, or BHLH42/TT8. Involved in the control of flavonoid late metabolism in developing siliques. Plays a key role in determining the tissue-specific activation of leucoanthocyanidin reductase (BANYULS).
    SUBUNIT: Interacts with BHLH2/EGL3/MYC146, BHLH12/MYC1 and BHLH42/TT8.

P27900 Trichome differentiation protein GL1; Myb-related protein 0; AtMYB0; Protein GLABRA 1; Protein GLABROUS 1; R2R3-MYB transcription factor GL1 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (52% identity, 52% coverage)
NP_189430 myb domain protein 0 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT3G27920 ATMYB0 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 0); DNA binding / protein binding / transcription activator/ transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription activator, when associated with BHLH2/EGL3/MYC146 or BHLH12/MYC1. Involved in epidermal cell fate specification in leaves. Together with TTG1 and GL3, promotes trichome formation and endoreplication. Regulates the production of a signal that induces hair (trichome) precursor cells on leaf primordia to differentiate. Binds to the WER-binding sites (WBS) promoter regions and activates the transcription of target genes (By similarity).
    SUBUNIT: Homodimer and heterodimer with MYB82 (PubMed:24803498). Interacts directly with GL3 and BHLH2. Part of a complex made of GL1, GL3 or BHLH2, and TTG1. Interacts also with BHLH2/EGL3/MYC146 and BHLH12/MYC1. Interacts with MYB82 (PubMed:24803498).
  • Tc-MYBPA an Arabidopsis TT2-like transcription factor and functions in the regulation of proanthocyanidin synthesis in Theobroma cacao
    Liu, BMC plant biology 2015
    • “...from 1000 replicates.   • A single amino acid substitution in the R3 domain of GLABRA1 leads to inhibition of trichome formation in Arabidopsis without affecting its interaction with GLABRA3.
    Dai, Plant, cell & environment 2016 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: These results suggested that the Serine 92 in the conserved [D/E]Lx2 [R/K]x3Lx6Lx3R amino acid signature of GL1 is not essential for the interaction of GL1 and GL3, but may play a role in the binding of GL1 to the promoters of its target genes.
  • TRANSPARENT TESTA GLABRA1 and GLABRA1 Compete for Binding to GLABRA3 in Arabidopsis.
    Pesch, Plant physiology 2015
    • GeneRIF: GL1 represses the activation of the TRY promoter by GL3 and TTG1, and TTG1 suppresses the activation of the CPC promoter by GL1 and GL3.
  • MYB82 functions in regulation of trichome development in Arabidopsis.
    Liang, Journal of experimental botany 2014
    • GeneRIF: Protein interaction analysis revealed that MYB82 physically interacts with GLABRA3. In addition, MYB82 and GL1 can form homodimers and heterodimers at R2R3-MYB domains, which may explain why their overexpression reduces trichome numbers.
  • The promoter structure differentiation of a MYB transcription factor RLC1 causes red leaf coloration in Empire Red Leaf Cotton under light
    Gao, PloS one 2013
    • “...NtAN2 (ACO52470), CsRuby (AFB73909), AmROSEA2 (ABB83827), AmVENOSA1 (ABB83828), AtMYB90 (AAG42002), AtMYB113 (NP_176811), AtWER (NP_196979), AtMYB0 (NP_189430), GhMyb10 (CAD87010), MdMYB10 (ABB84753), MdMYB1 (ABK58136), PhAN2 (AAF66727), PhPHZ (ADW94951), PhDPL (ADW94950), VvMYBA1 (BAD18977), VvMYBA2 (BAD18978), and NtAN2 (ACO52470).   • Mutual control of intracellular localisation of the patterning proteins AtMYC1, GL1 and TRY/CPC in Arabidopsis.
    Pesch, Development (Cambridge, England) 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: AtMYC1 protein is predominantly localised in the cytoplasm and can relocate GL1 from the nucleus into the cytoplasm.
  • Natural variation in GL1 and its effects on trichome density in Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Bloomer, Molecular ecology 2012 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: GL1 has qualitative and likely quantitative effects on trichome density in natural populations of Arabidopsis thaliana.
  • The glabra1 mutation affects cuticle formation and plant responses to microbes.
    Xia, Plant physiology 2010
    • GeneRIF: Impaired fatty acid/lipid flux is associated with a nonallelic GLABRA1 mutation which causes abnormal cuticle formation and impaired plant immunity.
  • A systems approach reveals regulatory circuitry for Arabidopsis trichome initiation by the GL3 and GL1 selectors.
    Morohashi, PLoS genetics 2009
    • GeneRIF: 20 novel genes in the regulatory network involved in the trichome formation are the direct targets of GL3/GL1.

Q9FJ07 Transcription factor MYB111; Myb-related protein 111; AtMYB111; Protein PRODUCTION OF FLAVONOL GLYCOSIDES 3 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (60% identity, 31% coverage)
NP_199744 myb domain protein 111 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT5G49330 AtMYB111 (myb domain protein 111); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Flavonol-specific transcription activator involved in the regulation of several genes of flavonoid biosynthesis. Activates the expression of CHS, CHI, F3H and FLS1. Controls flavonol biosynthesis primarily in cotyledons and leaves (PubMed:17419845, PubMed:20731781). Confers tolerance to UV-B (PubMed:19895401).
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Reduced flavonols levels in leaves. The double mutants myb11 myb111 and myb12 myb111 and triple mutant myb11 myb12 myb111 accumulate less flavonols in roots, leaves, stems, inflorescence, and siliques (PubMed:20731781). The triple mutant myb11 myb12 myb111 is impaired in flavonols biosynthesis and exhibits a reduced UV-B tolerance (PubMed:17419845, PubMed:19895401).

    • GeneRIF: AtMyb7 negatively controls the expression of the gene encoding bZIP transcription factor, ABI5, which is a key transcription factor in abscisic acid (ABA) signalling and serves as a crucial regulator of germination inhibition in Arabidopsis.

Q9SZP1 Transcription repressor MYB4; Myb-related protein 4; AtMYB4 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (62% identity, 36% coverage) (see paper)
NP_195574 myb domain protein 4 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT4G38620 MYB4; DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription repressor involved in regulation of protection against UV. Mediates transcriptional repression of CYP73A5, the gene encoding trans-cinnamate 4-monooxygenase, thereby regulating the accumulation of the UV-protectant compound sinapoylmalate.
    SUBUNIT: Interacts with BHLH12/MYC1 and BHLH42/TT8 (PubMed:15361138). Interacts with SAD2 (PubMed:17993626).
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Defects lead to a better tolerance of UV-B irradiation due to the increase in sinapate ester accumulation.

Q9FLR1 Transcription factor MYB29; Myb-related protein 29; AtMYB29; Protein HIGH ALIPHATIC GLUCOSINOLATE 3; Protein PRODUCTION OF METHIONINE-DERIVED GLUCOSINOLATE 2 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (60% identity, 31% coverage) (see paper)
NP_196386 myb domain protein 29 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT5G07690 ATMYB29 (ARABIDOPSIS THALIANA MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 29); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Plays a minor rheostat role in aliphatic glucosinolates (GLSs) biosynthesis, mostly short chained. Together with MYB28/HAG1 and MYB76/HAG2, promotes aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis but represses indolic glucosinolate biosynthesis. Prevents insect performance (e.g. lepidopteran insect Mamestra brassicae) by promoting glucosinolates.
    SUBUNIT: Can form complexes with MYC2, MYC3 or MYC4
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Low levels of aliphatic glucosinolates.
  • Glucose signalling positively regulates aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis.
    Miao, Journal of experimental botany 2013
    • GeneRIF: MYB28 and MYB29 synergistically functioned in the glucose-induced biosynthesis of aliphatic glucosinolates, but MYB28 was predominant over MYB29.
  • Novel insights into the function of Arabidopsis R2R3-MYB transcription factors regulating aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis.
    Li, Plant & cell physiology 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: MYB28 expression was induced by sulfur deficiency, while the expression levels of MYB29 and MYB76 were positively correlated with sulfur concentration.
  • A complex interplay of three R2R3 MYB transcription factors determines the profile of aliphatic glucosinolates in Arabidopsis.
    SÃ¸nderby, Plant physiology 2010
    • GeneRIF: MYB76 is not dependent on MYB28 and MYB29 for induction of aliphatic glucosinolates.
  • HAG2/MYB76 and HAG3/MYB29 exert a specific and coordinated control on the regulation of aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis in Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Gigolashvili, The New phytologist 2008 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: HAG1/MYB28, HAG2/MYB76 and HAG3/MYB29 reciprocally transactivated each other in the control of aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis and downregulated the expression of genes involved in the control of indolic glucosinolate biosynthesis.
  • Omics-based identification of Arabidopsis Myb transcription factors regulating aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis.
    Hirai, Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America 2007
    • GeneRIF: Myb29 presumably plays an accessory function for methyl jasmonate-mediated induction of a set of aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthetic genes.
  • Genome-wide association analysis reveals distinct genetic architectures for single and combined stress responses in Arabidopsis thaliana
    Davila, The New phytologist 2017
    • “...insect herbivores were identified. For P . rapae , QTL 15 on chromosome 5 contained AT5G07690 ( MYB29 ) and AT5G0700 ( MYB76 ) (TableS3). The closest significant SNP (Chr5: 2454480) explained 4% of the phenotypic variance. The Col0 allele was rare (55 accessions including Col0)...”

    Rhee, Genetics 2010
    • GeneRIF: Four unique tissue culture-derived epialleles of the pericarp color1 (p1) gene of maize (Zea mays L.), were characterized.
  • Gene structure induced epigenetic modifications of pericarp color1 alleles of maize result in tissue-specific mosaicism.
    Robbins, PloS one 2009
    • GeneRIF: The modification of tandem repeats of P1-mm (p1 allele called P1-mosaic) may have disrupted the epigenetic mechanisms that stably confer tissue-specific expression.
  • A Mutator transposon insertion is associated with ectopic expression of a tandemly repeated multicopy Myb gene pericarp color1 of maize.
    Robbins, Genetics 2008
    • GeneRIF: The Mu1 insertion interferes with the DNA methylation and related chromatin packaging of P1-wr allele, thereby inducing expression from gene copy (or copies) that is otherwise suppressed.
  • RNA-dependent RNA polymerase is required for enhancer-mediated transcriptional silencing associated with paramutation at the maize p1 gene.
    Sidorenko, Genetics 2008
    • GeneRIF: silencing occurs at the transcriptional level and that a specific enhancer fragment from p1 is sufficient to induce all aspects of paramutation.

O22264 Transcription factor MYB12; Myb-related protein 12; AtMYB12; Protein PRODUCTION OF FLAVONOL GLYCOSIDES 1 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (59% identity, 28% coverage)
NP_182268 myb domain protein 12 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT2G47460 MYB12 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 12); DNA binding / transcription activator/ transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Flavonol-specific transcription activator involved in the regulation of several genes of flavonoid biosynthesis. Activates the expression of CHS, CHI, F3H and FLS1. Controls flavonol biosynthesis mainly in the root (PubMed:17419845, PubMed:20731781). Confers tolerance to UV-B (PubMed:19895401).
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Reduced flavonols levels in roots. The double mutant myb12 myb111 and triple mutant myb11 myb12 myb111 accumulate less flavonols in roots, leaves, stems, inflorescence, and siliques. The double mutant myb11 myb12 is specifically altered in flavonols content of siliques and roots (PubMed:20731781). The triple mutant myb11 myb12 myb111 is impaired in flavonols biosynthesis and exhibits a reduced UV-B tolerance (PubMed:17419845, PubMed:19895401).
  • Elucidating the biosynthetic and regulatory mechanisms of flavonoid-derived bioactive components in Epimedium sagittatum
    Huang, Frontiers in plant science 2015
    • “...), AtMYB7 ( NP_179263 ), AtMYB32 ( NP_195225 ), AtMYB11 ( NP_191820 ), AtMYB12 ( O22264 ), AtMYB111 ( NP_199744 ), AtMYB5 ( NP_187963 ), AtMYB75 (AtPAP1, AAG42001), AtMYB90 (AtPAP2, AAG42002), AtMYB113 ( NP_176811 ), AtMYB114 ( NP_176812 ); Fragaria x ananassa : FaMYB1 ( AAK84064...”
  • AtMYB12 regulates flavonoids accumulation and abiotic stress tolerance in transgenic Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Wang, Molecular genetics and genomics : MGG 2016 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: Results showed that AtMYB12-overexpressing Arabidopsis plants exhibited increased levels of flavonoids and enhanced salt and drought tolerance suggesting that overexpression of AtMYB12 up-regulates genes involved in flavonoid biosynthesis, abscisic acid biosynthesis, proline biosynthesis and ROS-scavenging system, resulting in significant physiological changes.
  • Gene Expression Profiling of Development and Anthocyanin Accumulation in Kiwifruit (Actinidia chinensis) Based on Transcriptome Sequencing
    Li, PloS one 2015

    Pandey, Scientific reports 2015
    • GeneRIF: results demonstrate that modulation of primary carbon metabolism and other pathways by AtMYB12 in tomato may lead to sufficient substrate supply for enhanced content of phenolics in general and flavonols in particular.

    Nakabayashi, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2014
    • GeneRIF: The quantity and diversity of flavonoids is increased by overexpressing MYB12/PAP1. Flavonoids enhances both biotic and abiotic stress tolerance in crops.
  • Heterologous expression of AtMYB12 in kale (Brassica oleracea var. acephala) leads to high flavonol accumulation.
    LÃ¤nnenpÃ¤Ã¤, Plant cell reports 2014 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: AtMYB12 was overexpressed in a commercial cultivar of kale and the transgenic plants were tested both in in vitro and in semi-field conditions. A severalfold increase in both total phenolics content and flavonol accumulation was achieved.

Q9SPG2 Transcription factor MYB28; Myb-related protein 28; AtMYB28; Protein HIGH ALIPHATIC GLUCOSINOLATE 1; Protein PRODUCTION OF METHIONINE-DERIVED GLUCOSINOLATE 1 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (58% identity, 29% coverage) (see paper)
NP_200950 myb domain protein 28 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT5G61420 MYB28 (myb domain protein 28); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Major regulator of short-chained aliphatic glucosinolates (GLSs) biosynthesis. Together with MYB29/HAG3 and MYB76/HAG2, promotes aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis but represses indolic glucosinolate biosynthesis. Prevents insect performance (e.g. lepidopteran insect Mamestra brassicae and Spodoptera exigua) by promoting glucosinolates.
    SUBUNIT: Can form complexes with MYC2, MYC3 or MYC4
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Low levels of aliphatic glucosinolates and decreased repressing effect of brassinosteroid on glucosinolates.
  • Glucose signalling positively regulates aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis.
    Miao, Journal of experimental botany 2013
    • GeneRIF: MYB28 and MYB29 synergistically functioned in the glucose-induced biosynthesis of aliphatic glucosinolates, but MYB28 was predominant over MYB29.
  • Novel insights into the function of Arabidopsis R2R3-MYB transcription factors regulating aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis.
    Li, Plant & cell physiology 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: MYB28 expression was induced by sulfur deficiency, while the expression levels of MYB29 and MYB76 were positively correlated with sulfur concentration.
  • Role of camalexin, indole glucosinolates, and side chain modification of glucosinolate-derived isothiocyanates in defense of Arabidopsis against Sclerotinia sclerotiorum.
    Stotz, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2011 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: Mutant plants deficient in camalexin, indole, or aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis were hypersusceptible to S. sclerotiorum, among them the myb28 mutant, which has a defect resulting in decreased production of long-chained aliphatic glucosinolates.
  • A complex interplay of three R2R3 MYB transcription factors determines the profile of aliphatic glucosinolates in Arabidopsis.
    SÃ¸nderby, Plant physiology 2010
    • GeneRIF: MYB76 is not dependent on MYB28 and MYB29 for induction of aliphatic glucosinolates.
  • Omics-based identification of Arabidopsis Myb transcription factors regulating aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis.
    Hirai, Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America 2007
    • GeneRIF: Myb28 is a positive regulator for basal-level production of aliphatic glucosinolates.
  • The R2R3-MYB transcription factor HAG1/MYB28 is a regulator of methionine-derived glucosinolate biosynthesis in Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Gigolashvili, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2007 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: We hypothesize that HAG1/MYB28 is a novel regulator of aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis that controls the response to biotic challenges
  • The Defense Metabolite, Allyl Glucosinolate, Modulates Arabidopsis thaliana Biomass Dependent upon the Endogenous Glucosinolate Pathway

Q9SPG5 Transcription factor MYB76; Myb-related protein 76; AtMYB76; Protein HIGH ALIPHATIC GLUCOSINOLATE 2 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (59% identity, 31% coverage)
NP_001318501 myb domain protein 76 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT5G07700 MYB76 (myb domain protein 76); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Plays a role in determining the spatial distribution of aliphatic glucosinolates (AGLSs) within the leaf, mostly short chained. Together with MYB28/HAG1 and MYB29/HAG3, promotes aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis and represses indolic glucosinolate biosynthesis, but could not activate AGSL biosynthesis on its own.
    SUBUNIT: Can form complexes with MYC2, MYC3 or MYC4
  • Novel insights into the function of Arabidopsis R2R3-MYB transcription factors regulating aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis.
    Li, Plant & cell physiology 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: MYB28 expression was induced by sulfur deficiency, while the expression levels of MYB29 and MYB76 were positively correlated with sulfur concentration.
  • A complex interplay of three R2R3 MYB transcription factors determines the profile of aliphatic glucosinolates in Arabidopsis.
    SÃ¸nderby, Plant physiology 2010
    • GeneRIF: not dependent on MYB28 and MYB29 for induction of aliphatic glucosinolates, plays a role in determining the spatial distribution of aliphatic glucosinolates within the leaf
  • HAG2/MYB76 and HAG3/MYB29 exert a specific and coordinated control on the regulation of aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis in Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Gigolashvili, The New phytologist 2008 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: HAG1/MYB28, HAG2/MYB76 and HAG3/MYB29 reciprocally transactivated each other in the control of aliphatic glucosinolate biosynthesis and downregulated the expression of genes involved in the control of indolic glucosinolate biosynthesis.

    Ding, Journal of genetics and genomics = Yi chuan xue bao 2009 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: transgenic expression of MYB15, encoding a R2R3 MYB transcription factor in Arabidopsis thaliana, conferred hypersensitivity to exogenous abscisic acid (ABA) and improved tolerance to drought and salt stresses

    • GeneRIF: myb15 mutant plants show increased tolerance to freezing stress whereas its overexpression reduces freezing tolerance

O64399 Transcription factor MYB34; Myb-related protein 34; AtMYB34; Protein ALTERED TRYPTOPHAN REGULATION 1; ATR1 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (44% identity, 51% coverage)
NP_200897 myb domain protein 34 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT5G60890 MYB34 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 34); DNA binding / kinase/ transcription activator/ transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription factor involved in tryptophan gene activation and in indole-3-acetic acid (IAA) and indolic glucosinolates (IG) biosynthesis. Acts as a direct transcriptional activator of both Trp synthesis genes and Trp secondary metabolism genes.
    SUBUNIT: Can form complexes with MYC2, MYC3 or MYC4
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: No visible phenotype. Reduced indolic glucosinolate levels in adult leaves and loss of responses to brassinosteroids.
  • The downy mildew effector proteins ATR1 and ATR13 promote disease susceptibility in Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Sohn, The Plant cell 2007
    • GeneRIF: Results conclude that ATR1 positively contribute to pathogen virulence inside host cells.
  • The Arabidopsis ATR1 Myb transcription factor controls indolic glucosinolate homeostasis.
    Celenza, Plant physiology 2005
    • GeneRIF: The role of ATR1 in the expression of mulitple gene affecting tryptophan metabolism.

Q9LZK4 Transcription factor MYB11; Myb-related protein 11; AtMYB11; Protein PRODUCTION OF FLAVONOL GLYCOSIDES 2 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (58% identity, 31% coverage)
AT3G62610, NP_191820 myb domain protein 11 from Arabidopsis thaliana
NP_191820 ATMYB11 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 11); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Modulates overall growth by reducing the proliferation activity of meristematic cells and delaying development (PubMed:18359753). Flavonol-specific transcription activator involved in the regulation of several genes of flavonoid biosynthesis. Activates the expression of CHS, CHI, F3H and FLS1 (PubMed:17419845, PubMed:20731781). Confers tolerance to UV-B (PubMed:19895401).
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Accelerated germination, faster hypocotyl and primary root elongation, more lateral and adventitious roots formation, faster development of the inflorescence, and more lateral inflorescences initiation and fruits (PubMed:18359753). The double mutant myb11 myb111 and triple mutant myb11 myb12 myb111 accumulate less flavonols in roots, leaves, stems, inflorescence, and siliques. The double mutant myb11 myb12 is specifically altered in flavonols content of siliques (PubMed:20731781). The triple mutant myb11 myb12 myb111 is impaired in flavonols biosynthesis and exhibits a reduced UV-B tolerance (PubMed:17419845, PubMed:19895401).
  • Identification of drought-responsive microRNAs and their targets in Ammopiptanthus mongolicus by using high-throughput sequencing
    Gao, Scientific reports 2016
    • “...factors. Q9C9C8 Transcription factor MYB122; Myb-related protein 122; AtMYB122 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (56% identity, 32% coverage) (see paper)

MYB122 myb domain protein 122 from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription factor involved in glucosinolates biosynthesis.

O49782 Transcription factor MYB51; Myb-related protein 51; AtMYB51; Protein HIGH INDOLIC GLUCOSINOLATE 1; Transcription factor HIG1 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (58% identity, 30% coverage)
AT1G18570 MYB51 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 51); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana
NP_173292 myb domain protein 51 from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription factor positively regulating indolic glucosinolate biosynthetic pathway genes.
    SUBUNIT: Can form complexes with MYC2, MYC3 or MYC4
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Low levels of indolic glucosinolates.

    • GeneRIF: Transgenic Camelina plants overexpressing Arabidopsis MYB96 enhanced tolerance to drought. Deposition of epicuticular wax crystals and total wax loads increased significantly on the surfaces of transgenic leaves.

Q9SCU7 Transcription factor MYB30; Myb-related protein 30; AtMYB30 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (57% identity, 33% coverage)
NP_189533 myb domain protein 30 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT3G28910 MYB30 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 30); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription factor that binds specifically to the DNA sequence 5'-AACAAAC-3' (PubMed:19170933). Acts as a positive regulator of hypersensitive cell death (PubMed:10571865, PubMed:12119395). Acts as a positive regulator of salicylic acid synthesis (PubMed:16730712). Regulates very-long-chain fatty acid biosynthesis (PubMed:18326828). Acts cooperatively with BZR2 to promote expression of a subset of brassinosteroids target genes (PubMed:19170933). Transcriptional activity and hypersensitive response control negatively regulated by PLA2-ALPHA and by the Xanthomonas type III effector XopD (AC G9L9K6) (PubMed:20696912, PubMed:21917550). Involved in the regulation of abscisic acid (ABA) signaling (PubMed:22814374). Increased levels of MYB30 can accelerate flowering both in long and short days through the regulation of FT (PubMed:24587042).
    SUBUNIT: Interacts with MIEL1 (PubMed:23403577). Interacts with BZR2 (PubMed:19170933). Interacts with PLA2-ALPHA (PubMed:20696912). Interacts with the Xanthomonas type III effector XopD (AC G9L9K6) (via HLH domain) (PubMed:21917550).
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Altered brassinosteroids response phenotypes (PubMed:19170933). Hypersensitivity to ABA during germination and seedling growth (PubMed:22814374).
  • S-nitrosylation influences the structure and DNA binding activity of AtMYB30 transcription factor from Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Tavares, Biochimica et biophysica acta 2014 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: S-nitrosylation influences the structure and DNA binding activity of MYB30 from Arabidopsis thaliana.
  • Elevated levels of MYB30 in the phloem accelerate flowering in Arabidopsis through the regulation of FLOWERING LOCUS T.
    Liu, PloS one 2014
    • GeneRIF: Elevated levels of MYB30 in the phloem accelerate flowering in Arabidopsis through the regulation of FLOWERING LOCUS T.
  • Arabidopsis ubiquitin ligase MIEL1 mediates degradation of the transcription factor MYB30 weakening plant defence.
    Marino, Nature communications 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: MIEL1 (MYB30-Interacting E3 Ligase1), an Arabidopsis RING-type E3 ubiquitin ligase that interacts with and ubiquitinates MYB30, leads to MYB30 proteasomal degradation and downregulation of its transcriptional activity.
  • Sumoylation of transcription factor MYB30 by the small ubiquitin-like modifier E3 ligase SIZ1 mediates abscisic acid response in Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Zheng, Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America 2012
    • GeneRIF: coordination of ABI5 and MYB30 sumoylation by SIZ1 may balance gene expression, which is required for regulation of ABA signaling during seed germination.
  • The Xanthomonas type III effector XopD targets the Arabidopsis transcription factor MYB30 to suppress plant defense.
    Canonne, The Plant cell 2011
    • GeneRIF: XopD relocalizes Arabidopsis MYB30 to nuclear foci and represses MYB30 transcriptional activity.
  • Expression of the Arabidopsis transcription factor AtMYB30 is post-transcriptionally regulated.
    Froidure, Plant physiology and biochemistry : PPB 2010 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: Results suggest that RNA silencing directly mediates downregulation of AtMYB30 expression, both in young seedlings and in adult plants.
  • AtsPLA2-alpha nuclear relocalization by the Arabidopsis transcription factor AtMYB30 leads to repression of the plant defense response.
    Froidure, Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America 2010
    • GeneRIF: AtMYB30 and the secreted phospholipase AtsPLA(2)-alpha physically interact in vivo, following the AtMYB30-mediated specific relocalization of AtsPLA(2)-alpha from cytoplasmic vesicles to the plant cell nucleus.
  • Arabidopsis MYB30 is a direct target of BES1 and cooperates with BES1 to regulate brassinosteroid-induced gene expression.
    Li, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2009
    • GeneRIF: BES1 and AtMYB30 function cooperatively to promote brassinosteroid target gene expression.
  • Transgenic expression of fungal accessory hemicellulases in Arabidopsis thaliana triggers transcriptional patterns related to biotic stress and defense response

Q50EX6 Protein ODORANT1; MYB-like protein ODO1 from Petunia hybrida (Petunia) (46% identity, 54% coverage) (see paper)

  • FUNCTION: R2R3 MYB-type transcription factor controlling the production of volatile benzoides in flowers by regulating the shikimate pathway, namely by activation of the 5-enol- pyruvylshikimate-3-phosphate synthase gene. This scent, mostly produced in the evening and night by the petals, attracts the pollinators. Anthocyanins production is not controlled by ODO1 as color and scent are produced at different stages of development.

Q9FG68 Transcription factor RAX1; Myb-related protein 37; AtMYB37; Protein REGULATOR OF AXILLARY MERISTEMS 1 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (42% identity, 47% coverage)
NP_197691 myb domain protein 37 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT5G23000 MYB37 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 37); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription activator of genes involved in the regulation of meristematic competence, such as CUC2. Positively regulates axillary meristems (AMs) formation and development, especially at early phases of vegetative growth, probably by specifying a stem cell niche for AM formation. Modulates the negative regulation mediated by gibberellic acid on the timing of developmental phase transitions.
  • A variant of LEAFY reveals its capacity to stimulate meristem development by inducing RAX1.
    Chahtane, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: A LFY allele with reduced floral function revealed its ability to stimulate axillary meristem growth. This role requires the ability of LFY to bind DNA, and is mediated by direct induction of REGULATOR OF AXILLARY MERISTEMS1 (RAX1) by LFY.
  • The bHLH protein ROX acts in concert with RAX1 and LAS to modulate axillary meristem formation in Arabidopsis.
    Yang, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2012 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: ROX regulates axillary meristem formation redundantly with RAX1 and LAS.
  • Blind homologous R2R3 Myb genes control the pattern of lateral meristem initiation in Arabidopsis.
    MÃ¼ller, The Plant cell 2006
    • GeneRIF: rax mutants show new phenotypes that are characterized by defects in lateral bud formation in overlapping zones along the shoot axis. RAX genes are partially redundant in function and allow a fine-tuning of secondary axis formation [RAX1]
  • Arabidopsis REGULATOR OF AXILLARY MERISTEMS1 controls a leaf axil stem cell niche and modulates vegetative development.
    Keller, The Plant cell 2006
    • GeneRIF: RAX1 functions to positionally specify a stem cell niche for axillary meristem formation and affects the timing of developmental phase transitions by negatively regulating gibberellic acid levels in the shoot apex. [RAX1]
  • The founder-cell transcriptome in the Arabidopsis apetala1 cauliflower inflorescence meristem

XP_009141138 myb-related protein Myb4 from Brassica rapa (54% identity, 42% coverage)

  • BrMYB4, a suppressor of genes for phenylpropanoid and anthocyanin biosynthesis, is down-regulated by UV-B but not by pigment-inducing sunlight in turnip cv. Tsuda.
    Zhang, Plant & cell physiology 2014 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: BrMYB4 functions as a negative transcriptional regulator of BrC4H and mediates UV-B-dependent phenylpropanoid biosynthesis. However, sunlight-induced anthocyanin biosynthesis does not seem to be regulated by BrMYB4.

  • FUNCTION: Transcription factor that regulates positively genes involved in anthocyanin biosynthesis such as A1.

  • Transcription factors that directly regulate the expression of CSLA9 encoding mannan synthase in Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Kim, Plant molecular biology 2014 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: Data indicate that transcription factors ANAC041, bZIP1 and MYB46 directly regulate the expression of CSLA9.
  • Identification of direct targets of transcription factor MYB46 provides insights into the transcriptional regulation of secondary wall biosynthesis.
    Kim, Plant molecular biology 2014 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: MYB46 functions as a central and direct regulator of the genes involved in the biosynthesis of all three major secondary wall components.
  • The MYB46/MYB83-mediated transcriptional regulatory programme is a gatekeeper of secondary wall biosynthesis.
    Ko, Annals of botany 2014
    • GeneRIF: MYB46 is a unique transcription factor in that it directly regulates the biosynthesis genes for all of the three major components of the secondary wall as well as the transcription factors in the biosynthesis pathway.
  • Transcription factor MYB46 is an obligate component of the transcriptional regulatory complex for functional expression of secondary wall-associated cellulose synthases in Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Kim, Journal of plant physiology 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: Data conclude that MYB46 is an obligate component of the transcriptional regulatory complex toward the commitment of secondary wall cellulose synthesis in Arabidopsis.
  • MYB46 directly regulates the gene expression of secondary wall-associated cellulose synthases in Arabidopsis.
    Kim, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: directly regulates all three secondary wall-associated cellulose synthase genes
  • MYB46 and MYB83 bind to the SMRE sites and directly activate a suite of transcription factors and secondary wall biosynthetic genes.
    Zhong, Plant & cell physiology 2012 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: MYB46 activates the secondary wall MYB-responsive element sites in the promoters of MYB46 direct targets. MYB46 and MYB83 directly activate a set of downstream transcription factors.
  • Identification of a cis-acting regulatory motif recognized by MYB46, a master transcriptional regulator of secondary wall biosynthesis.
    Kim, Plant molecular biology 2012 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: MYB46 recognizes a cis-acting regulatory motif M46RE
  • MYB46-mediated transcriptional regulation of secondary wall biosynthesis.
    Ko, Molecular plant 2012 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: MYB46 mediated the transcriptional regulation of secondary wall biosynthesis.
  • More

Q9XHV0 Transcription factor MYB80; MYB-related protein 103; AtMYB103; Myb-related protein 80; AtMYB80; Protein MALE STERILE 188 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (56% identity, 32% coverage) (see paper)
NP_200422 myb domain protein 103 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT5G56110 ATMYB103 (ARABIDOPSIS THALIANA MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 103); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription factor that binds to the DNA sequence 5'- CCAACC-3'. Regulates directly PME5, UND and GLOX1 (PubMed:21673079). Essential for tapetum development in anthers and microsporogenesis (PubMed:12848824, PubMed:21673079). Regulates the timing of tapetal programmed cell death (PCD) which is critical for pollen development. May act through the activation of UND, encoding an A1 aspartic protease (PubMed:21673079). Required for anther development by regulating tapetum development, callose dissolution and exine formation. Acts upstream of A6 and FAR2/MS2, two genes required for pollen exine formation (PubMed:17727613). Negatively regulates trichome endoreduplication and trichome branching (PubMed:12848824).
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Male sterility due to distorted pollen grains lacking reticulate exine on their surface.
  • MYB80 homologues in Arabidopsis, cotton and Brassica: regulation and functional conservation in tapetal and pollen development.
    Xu, BMC plant biology 2014
    • GeneRIF: The MYB80 homologs fused with the EAR repressor motif have been shown to induce male sterility in Arabidopsis.
  • MYB103 is required for FERULATE-5-HYDROXYLASE expression and syringyl lignin biosynthesis in Arabidopsis stems.
    Ãhman, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: required for FERULATE-5-HYDROXYLASE expression and syringyl lignin biosynthesis
  • MYB80, a regulator of tapetal and pollen development, is functionally conserved in crops.
    Phan, Plant molecular biology 2012 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: Data show that the MYB80 homolog genes, driven by the AtMYB80 or their respective promoters, rescued the atmyb80 mutant, completely restoring male fertility.
  • The MYB80 transcription factor is required for pollen development and the regulation of tapetal programmed cell death in Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Phan, The Plant cell 2011
    • GeneRIF: Data suggest that the timing of tapetal programmed cell death is critical for pollen development, and the MYB80/UNDEAD system may regulate that timing.
  • A genetic pathway for tapetum development and function in Arabidopsis.
    Zhu, Journal of integrative plant biology 2011 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: DYT1, TDF1 and AMS function in early tapetum development, while MS188 and MS1 are important for late tapetum development.
  • AtMYB103 is a crucial regulator of several pathways affecting Arabidopsis anther development.
    Zhu, Science China. Life sciences 2010 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: These results indicate that AtMYB103 is a crucial regulator of Arabidopsis anther development.
  • A putative MYB35 ortholog is a candidate for the sex-determining genes in Asparagus officinalis

Q9FKL2 Transcription factor MYB36; Myb-related protein 36; AtMYB36 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (57% identity, 31% coverage)
NP_200570 myb domain protein 36 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT5G57620 MYB36 (myb domain protein 36); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription factors that activates genes required for endodermal differentiation but represses genes involved in proliferative divisions, thus regulating the transition from proliferation to differentiation in root endodermis (PubMed:26371322). Required for Casparian strip formation by positively regulating the expression of the Casparian strip genes CASP1, PER64 and ESB1 and other endodermis-specific genes, thus triggering correct localized lignin biosynthesis in root endodermis and subsequently regulating global ion homeostasis (PubMed:26124109, PubMed:26371322).
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: In myb36-1, myb36-2 and myb36-4, impaired Casparian strips formation replaced by ectopic lignin-like material in the corners of endodermal cells, associated with reduced expression of several endodermis-specific genes and abnormal CASP1 localization in the plasma membrane (PubMed:26124109, PubMed:26371322). Multiple changes to leaf ionome, including elevated concentrations of sodium, magnesium, and zinc and decreased calcium, manganese, and iron. Longer root hairs (PubMed:26124109). Delayed and defective barrier (Casparian strips) formation as well as extra cell divisions in the meristem in roots (PubMed:26371322).
  • Control of Arabidopsis lateral root primordium boundaries by MYB36.
    FernÃ¡ndez-Marcos, The New phytologist 2017
    • GeneRIF: results uncover a role for MYB36 outside the endodermis during LRP development through a mechanism analogous to regulating the proliferation/differentiation transition in the root meristem.
  • The MYB36 transcription factor orchestrates Casparian strip formation.
    Kamiya, Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America 2015
    • GeneRIF: MYB36 is controlling expression of the machinery required to locally polymerize lignin in a fine band in the cell wall for the formation of the Casparian strip
  • MYB36 regulates the transition from proliferation to differentiation in the Arabidopsis root.
    Liberman, Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of the United States of America 2015
    • GeneRIF: MYB36 regulates the transition from proliferation to differentiation in the Arabidopsis root.
  • The Histone Deacetylase Inhibitor Suberoylanilide Hydroxamic Acid Alleviates Salinity Stress in Cassava

Q7XQN1 Transcription factor MYB80; Myb-related protein 80; OsMYB80 from Oryza sativa subsp. japonica (Rice) (54% identity, 28% coverage) (see paper)

  • FUNCTION: Essential for tapetum development in anthers and microsporogenesis. May regulate the timing of tapetal programmed cell death (PCD) which is critical for pollen development.

Q9M0K4 Transcription factor LAF1; Myb-related protein 18; AtMYB18; Protein LONG AFTER FAR-RED LIGHT 1 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (55% identity, 36% coverage) (see paper)
AT4G25560 AtMYB18 (myb domain protein 18); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana
NP_194286 myb domain protein 18 from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription factor that promotes photomorphogenesis in the light by participating in the transmission of phytochrome A (phyA) signals to downstream responses (PubMed:11581165, PubMed:19482971). Probably acts by activating expression of light- induced genes. In darkness, its degradation prevents the activation of light-induced genes (PubMed:11581165).
    SUBUNIT: Binds to FHY1 and FHL (PubMed:19482971). Interacts with COP1.
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Partially blind to far-red (FR). Impaired inhibition of hypocotyl elongation and cotyledons expansion under continuous FR light conditions.

  • Three transcription factors, HFR1, LAF1 and HY5, regulate largely independent signaling pathways downstream of phytochrome A.
    Jang, Plant & cell physiology 2013
    • GeneRIF: HY5 transmits phyA signals through an FHY1/FHL-independent pathway but it may also modulate FHY1/FHL signal through its interaction with HFR1 and LAF1.[LAF1]
  • Independent and interdependent functions of LAF1 and HFR1 in phytochrome A signaling.
    Jang, Genes & development 2007
    • GeneRIF: in addition to their independent functions in phyA signaling, LAF1 and HFR1 also cooperate post-translationally to stabilize each other through inhibition of ubiquitination by COP1, thereby enhancing phyA photoresponses

NP_176012 myb domain protein 72 from Arabidopsis thaliana (52% identity, 35% coverage)
AT1G56160 MYB72 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 72); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • Î²-Glucosidase BGLU42 is a MYB72-dependent key regulator of rhizobacteria-induced systemic resistance and modulates iron deficiency responses in Arabidopsis roots.
    Zamioudis, The New phytologist 2014 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: MYB72 regulates the expression of genes associated with the production of iron mobilizing phenolic metabolites, and that BGLU42 plays an important role in the secretion of these compounds in the root vicinity.
  • MYB10 and MYB72 are required for growth under iron-limiting conditions.
    Palmer, PLoS genetics 2013
    • GeneRIF: our results provide evidence that MYB10 and MYB72 act early in the iron-deficiency regulatory cascade to drive gene expression of NAS4 and are essential for plant survival under iron deficiency
  • MYB72, a node of convergence in induced systemic resistance triggered by a fungal and a bacterial beneficial microbe.
    Segarra, Plant biology (Stuttgart, Germany) 2009 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: MYB72 functions as an early node of convergence in the signalling pathways that are induced by different beneficial microorganisms

O80883 Transcription factor MYB101; Myb-related protein 101; AtM1; AtMYB101; Protein ABNORMAL SHOOT 7 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (48% identity, 23% coverage)
AT2G32460 MYB101; DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana
NP_180805 myb domain protein 101 from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription activator (PubMed:24278028, PubMed:25268707). Binds to 5'-CAACTGTC-3' and/or 5'-TAACAAA-3' motif in target gene promoter (e.g. alpha-amylase) to promote their expression (PubMed:11743113). Positive regulator of abscisic acid (ABA) responses leading to growth arrest during seed germination (PubMed:17217461). Promotes the expression of aleurone-related genes (e.g. CP1, CP, GASA1, BXL1 and BXL2) in seeds. Together with MYB33 and MYB65, promotes the programmed cell death (PCD) leading to vacuolation of protein storage vacuoles (PSVs) in the aleurone layers during seed germination (PubMed:20699403). Maybe involved in the regulation of leaves lamina morphogenesis (PubMed:25268707). Involved in pollen grain development (PubMed:22101548). Together with MYB97 and MYB120, functions as a male factor that controls pollen tube-synergid interaction in fertilization. Required for pollen tube growth arrest and sperm cell release in the female gametophyte, probably via the regulation of pollen tube-specific gene expression (PubMed:24278028, PubMed:23791732).
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Hyposensitivity to abscisic acid (ABA) (PubMed:17217461). Reduced expression levels of aleurone-related genes (e.g. CP1, CP, GASA1, BXL1 and BXL2) in seeds. The triple mutant myb33 myb65 myb101 has a male sterility and exhibits slower protein storage vacuoles (PSVs) vacuolation rate in aleurone layers upon seed germination (PubMed:20699403). Reduced production of abnormal pollen grains with misarranged male germ unit (MGU) (PubMed:22101548). The triple mutant myb97 myb101 myb120 is impaired in pollen tube growth arrest and subsequent sperm cell release in the female gametophyte thus leading to a drastically reduced fertility. Altered pollen tube-specific gene expression (PubMed:23791732, PubMed:24278028).

    Rasheed, Frontiers in plant science 2016

  • The over-expression of two transcription factors, ABS5/bHLH30 and ABS7/MYB101, leads to upwardly curly leaves.
    An, PloS one 2014
    • GeneRIF: enhanced expressions of two transcription factors, bHLH30 and MYB101, are able to alter leaf lamina development.
  • MYB97, MYB101 and MYB120 function as male factors that control pollen tube-synergid interaction in Arabidopsis thaliana fertilization.
    Liang, PLoS genetics 2013

Q9SA47 Transcription factor MYB58; Myb-related protein 58; AtMYB58 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (51% identity, 38% coverage) (see paper)
NP_173098 myb domain protein 58 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT1G16490 MYB58 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 58); DNA binding / transcription activator/ transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcriptional activator that binds DNA to the AC cis- elements 5'-ACCTACC-3', 5'-ACCAACC-3' and 5'-ACCTAAC-3' of promoters and specifically activates lignin biosynthetic genes during secondary wall formation mediated by SND1.
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Reduction in secondary wall thickening and lignin content.
  • Enzymatic and metabolic engineering for efficient production of syringin, sinapyl alcohol 4-O-glucoside, in Arabidopsis thaliana.
    Chu, Phytochemistry 2014 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: The UGT72E3/2 was combined with the sinapyl alcohol synthesis pathway gene F5H encoding ferulate 5-hydroxylase and the lignin biosynthesis transcriptional activator MYB58.
  • MYB58 and MYB63 are transcriptional activators of the lignin biosynthetic pathway during secondary cell wall formation in Arabidopsis.
    Zhou, The Plant cell 2009
    • GeneRIF: MYB58 and MYB63 are specifically expressed in fibers and vessels undergoing secondary wall thickening, and are transcriptional activators of lignin biosynthesis.

Q9C9G7 Transcription factor MYB62; Myb-related protein 62; AtMYB62 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (59% identity, 36% coverage) (see paper)
AT1G68320 MYB62 (myb domain protein 62); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription repressor of phosphate (Pi) starvation- induced genes. Regulates negatively Pi starvation responses via the repression of gibberellic acid (GA) biosynthesis and signaling. Modulates root architecture, phosphatase activity, and Pi uptake and accumulation.

    Branscheid, Nucleic acids research 2015

  • MYB83 is a direct target of SND1 and acts redundantly with MYB46 in the regulation of secondary cell wall biosynthesis in Arabidopsis.
    McCarthy, Plant & cell physiology 2009 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: MYB83 and MYB46, both of which are SND1 direct targets, function redundantly in the transcriptional regulatory cascade leading to secondary wall formation in fibers and vessels.

Q9SSA1 Transcription factor MYB57; Myb-related protein 57; AtMYB57 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (52% identity, 41% coverage) (see paper)
NP_186802 myb domain protein 57 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT3G01530 AtMYB57 (myb domain protein 57); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription factor acting redundantly with MYB21 and MYB24 to control stamen filament elongation in the late developed flowers. Repressed at the transcript levels by DELLA proteins.
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: No visible phenotype. Myb21 and myb57 double mutant has an intermediate sterility phenotype and petals that grew to a final height parallel to the pistil. Myb24 and myb57 double mutant has petals that grew to a final height parallel to the pistil. Myb21, myb24 and myb57 triple mutant has a strongly reduced fertility and an arrested growth of the petals that never grew out of the sepals.
  • PIN6 is required for nectary auxin response and short stamen development.
    Bender, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: PIN6 and auxin, as well as the transcription factor MYB57, play a role in the regulation of nectar synthesis and secretion in Arabidopsis thaliana.

Q6R0A6 Transcription factor MYB63; Myb-related protein 63; AtMYB63 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (49% identity, 35% coverage) (see paper)
NP_178039 myb domain protein 63 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT1G79180 MYB63 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 63); DNA binding / transcription activator/ transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcriptional activator that binds DNA to the AC cis- elements 5'-ACCTACC-3', 5'-ACCAACC-3' and 5'-ACCTAAC-3' of promoters and specifically activates lignin biosynthetic genes during secondary wall formation mediated by SND1.
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Reduction in secondary wall thickening and lignin content.
  • MYB58 and MYB63 are transcriptional activators of the lignin biosynthetic pathway during secondary cell wall formation in Arabidopsis.
    Zhou, The Plant cell 2009
    • GeneRIF: MYB58 and MYB63 are specifically expressed in fibers and vessels undergoing secondary wall thickening, and are transcriptional activators of lignin biosynthesis.

    Tsai, PloS one 2017 (no snippet)

Q9SPG3 Transcription factor MYB26; Myb-related protein 26; AtMYB26; Protein MALE STERILE 35 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (50% identity, 29% coverage) (see paper)
NP_566467 myb domain protein 26 from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Probable transcription factor that regulates lignified secondary cell wall thickening of the anther endocethium, which is necessary for anther dehiscence (PubMed:12753590, PubMed:17147638, PubMed:17329564). May play a role in specifying early endothecial cell development by regulating a number of genes linked to secondary thickening such as NST1 and NST2. Acts upstream of the lignin biosynthesis pathway (PubMed:17329564).
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Male sterility due to a defect in anther dehiscence. Fertile pollen.

Q9LSI7 Transcription factor MYB35; Myb-related protein 35; AtMYB35; Protein DEFECTIVE IN TAPETAL DEVELOPMENT AND FUNCTION 1 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (53% identity, 31% coverage)
NP_189488 Duplicated homeodomain-like superfamily protein from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT3G28470 TDF1 (DEFECTIVE IN MERISTEM DEVELOPMENT AND FUNCTION 1); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Required for anther development and early tapetal function during microspore maturation (PubMed:18397379, PubMed:21957980). Regulates callose dissolution required for microspores release from the tetrads (PubMed:18397379).
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Male-sterile mutant, defective in tapetal development, characterized by irregular and excessive division, redundant cells and leading to dysfunction of the tapetum (PubMed:18397379, PubMed:21957980). Impaired callose dissolution resulting in altered microspores release from the tetrads and no pollen production (PubMed:18397379).
  • DYT1 directly regulates the expression of TDF1 for tapetum development and pollen wall formation in Arabidopsis.
    Gu, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2014 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: DYT1 regulates the expression of AMS, MS188/MYB80, TEK and MS1 for pollen wall formation, primarily via TDF1.
  • A genetic pathway for tapetum development and function in Arabidopsis.
    Zhu, Journal of integrative plant biology 2011 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: DYT1, TDF1 and AMS function in early tapetum development, while MS188 and MS1 are important for late tapetum development.
  • Defective in Tapetal development and function 1 is essential for anther development and tapetal function for microspore maturation in Arabidopsis.
    Zhu, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2008 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: The identification and characterization of TDF1 as a synonym for MYB35 using a map-based cloning strategy is reported.

  • MYB10 and MYB72 are required for growth under iron-limiting conditions.
    Palmer, PLoS genetics 2013
    • GeneRIF: our results provide evidence that MYB10 and MYB72 act early in the iron-deficiency regulatory cascade to drive gene expression of NAS4 and are essential for plant survival under iron deficiency.

Q9LK95 Transcription factor MYB21; Myb homolog 3; AtMyb3; Myb-related protein 21; AtMYB21 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (39% identity, 58% coverage) (see paper)
AT3G27810 ATMYB21 (ARABIDOPSIS THALIANA MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 21); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana
NP_189418 myb domain protein 21 from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription factor involved in photomorphogenesis in the light. May act downstream of the light receptor network and directly affects transcription of light-induced genes. In darkness, its probable degradation prevent the activation of light-induced genes. Required to activate expression of PAL. Acts redundantly with MYB24 and MYB57 to control stamen filament elongation in the late developed flowers. Contributes with MYB24 to induction of MYB108 by jasmonate. Repressed at the transcript levels by DELLA proteins.
    SUBUNIT: Interacts (via N-terminus) with TIFY10A/JAZ1, TIFY5A/JAZ8 AND TIFY3A/JAZ11.
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Short anther filaments, delayed anther dehiscence and greatly reduced male fertility. Myb21 and myb24 double mutant is more severely sterile than myb21 mutant and has petals that just grew out of the sepals but ended at a lower level than the stigma. Myb21 and myb57 double mutant has an intermediate sterility phenotype and petals that grew to a final height parallel to the pistil. Myb21, myb24 and myb57 triple mutant has a strongly reduced fertility and an arrested growth of the petals that never grew out of the sepals.

Q94FL7 Transcription factor MYB120; Myb-related protein 120; AtMYB120 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (51% identity, 20% coverage)
AT5G55020 MYB120 (MYB DOMAIN PROTEIN 120); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana
MYB120, NP_568819 myb domain protein 120 from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription activator (PubMed:24278028). Binds to 5'- CAACTGTC-3' and/or 5'-TAACAAA-3' motif in target gene promoter to promote their expression (By similarity). Together with MYB97 and MYB101, functions as a male factor that controls pollen tube- synergid interaction in fertilization. Required for pollen tube growth arrest and sperm cell release in the female gametophyte, probably via the regulation of pollen tube-specific gene expression (PubMed:24278028, PubMed:23791732).
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Disrupted pollen tube growth (PubMed:19714218). The triple mutant myb97 myb101 myb120 is impaired in pollen tube growth arrest and subsequent sperm cell release in the female gametophyte thus leading to a drastically reduced fertility. Altered pollen tube-specific gene expression (PubMed:23791732, PubMed:24278028).

Q9S773 Transcription factor MYB97; Myb-related protein 97; AtMYB97 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (48% identity, 28% coverage)
NP_194423 myb domain protein 97 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT4G26930 MYB97 (myb domain protein 97); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription activator (PubMed:24278028). Binds to 5'- CAACTGTC-3' and/or 5'-TAACAAA-3' motif in target gene promoter to promote their expression (By similarity). Together with MYB101 and MYB120, functions as a male factor that controls pollen tube- synergid interaction in fertilization. Required for pollen tube growth arrest and sperm cell release in the female gametophyte, probably via the regulation of pollen tube-specific gene expression (PubMed:24278028, PubMed:23791732).
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: The triple mutant myb97 myb101 myb120 is impaired in pollen tube growth arrest and subsequent sperm cell release in the female gametophyte thus leading to a drastically reduced fertility. Altered pollen tube-specific gene expression.
  • MYB97, MYB101 and MYB120 function as male factors that control pollen tube-synergid interaction in Arabidopsis thaliana fertilization.
    Liang, PLoS genetics 2013
    • GeneRIF: All these results indicate that MYB97, MYB101 and MYB120 participate in pollen tube reception, possibly by controlling the expression of downstream genes.

Q0JIC2 Transcription factor GAMYB; OsGAMyb from Oryza sativa subsp. japonica (Rice) (47% identity, 20% coverage) (see paper)

  • FUNCTION: Transcriptional activator of gibberellin-dependent alpha-amylase expression in aleurone cells. Involved in pollen and floral organs development. May bind to the 5'-TAACAAA-3' box of alpha-amylase promoter.
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Plants are not defective in root and leaf elongation, but present shortened internodes and defects in pollen and floral development.

A2WW87 Transcription factor GAMYB; OsGAMyb from Oryza sativa subsp. indica (Rice) (47% identity, 20% coverage) (see paper)

  • FUNCTION: Transcriptional activator of gibberellin-dependent alpha-amylase expression in aleurone cells. Involved in pollen and floral organs development. May bind to the 5'-TAACAAA-3' box of alpha-amylase promoter.

Q9SPG9 Transcription factor MYB24; Myb-related protein 24; AtMYB24 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (51% identity, 41% coverage) (see paper)
NP_198851 myb domain protein 24 from Arabidopsis thaliana
AT5G40350 MYB24 (myb domain protein 24); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription factor acting redundantly with MYB21 and MYB57 to control stamen filament elongation in the late developed flowers. Contributes with MYB21 to induction of MYB108 by jasmonate. Repressed at the transcript levels by DELLA proteins.
    SUBUNIT: Interacts (via N-terminus) with TIFY10A/JAZ1, TIFY5A/JAZ8 AND TIFY3A/JAZ11.
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: No visible phenotype. Myb24 and myb57 double mutant has petals that grew to a final height parallel to the pistil. Myb21 and myb24 double mutant is partially sterile and has petals that just grew out of the sepals but ended at a lower level than the stigma. Myb21, myb24 and myb57 triple mutant has a strongly reduced fertility and an arrested growth of the petals that never grew out of the sepals. Myb24 and myb108 double mutant has a reduced fertility and a greatly reduced seed set.
  • The Jasmonate-ZIM domain proteins interact with the R2R3-MYB transcription factors MYB21 and MYB24 to affect Jasmonate-regulated stamen development in Arabidopsis.
    Song, The Plant cell 2011
    • GeneRIF: Excess expression of MYB24 causes male sterility.
  • MYB108 acts together with MYB24 to regulate jasmonate-mediated stamen maturation in Arabidopsis.
    Mandaokar, Plant physiology 2009
    • GeneRIF: MYB108 and MYB24 have overlapping functions and act downstream of MYB21 in a transcriptional cascade that mediates stamen and pollen maturation in response to jasmonate in Arabidopsis.
  • Over-expression of a flower-specific transcription factor gene AtMYB24 causes aberrant anther development.
    Yang, Plant cell reports 2007 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: results suggest an important role of AtMYB24 in the normal development of anthers
  • Transcriptomic Analysis of Soil-Grown Arabidopsis thaliana Roots and Shoots in Response to a Drought Stress

  • More
  • MicroRNAs with analogous target complementarities perform with highly variable efficacies in Arabidopsis.
    Deveson, FEBS letters 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: There may be factors, in addition to complementarity, that control plant miRNA efficacy, such factors appear to be optimised in regards to the endogenous and ancient miR159:MYB33/65 relationship.
  • The microRNA159-regulated GAMYB-like genes inhibit growth and promote programmed cell death in Arabidopsis.
    Alonso-Peral, Plant physiology 2010
    • GeneRIF: MYB33 and MYB65 play no part in gibberellin-mediated growth or flowering in vegetative tissues.
  • The Arabidopsis GAMYB-like genes, MYB33 and MYB65, are microRNA-regulated genes that redundantly facilitate anther development.
    Millar, The Plant cell 2005
    • GeneRIF: Transformation with MYB33 containing the mutated microRNA target had dramatic pleiotrophic developmental defects, suggesting that restricting MYB33 expression, especially in the shoot apices, is essential for proper plant development.

NP_001324751 Duplicated homeodomain-like superfamily protein from Arabidopsis thaliana (51% identity, 31% coverage)

  • CRY1 inhibits COP1-mediated degradation of BIT1, a MYB transcription factor, to activate blue light-dependent gene expression in Arabidopsis.
    Hong, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2008 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: The MYB transcription factor Blue Insensitive Trait 1 (BIT1) functions as a positive element in blue light signaling. [BIT1]
  • Blind homologous R2R3 Myb genes control the pattern of lateral meristem initiation in Arabidopsis.
    MÃ¼ller, The Plant cell 2006
    • GeneRIF: rax mutants show new phenotypes that are characterized by defects in lateral bud formation in overlapping zones along the shoot axis. RAX genes are partially redundant in function and allow a fine-tuning of secondary axis formation [RAX2]

NP_001327043 myb domain protein 65 from Arabidopsis thaliana (45% identity, 24% coverage)

  • MicroRNAs with analogous target complementarities perform with highly variable efficacies in Arabidopsis.
    Deveson, FEBS letters 2013 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: There may be factors, in addition to complementarity, that control plant miRNA efficacy, such factors appear to be optimised in regards to the endogenous and ancient miR159:MYB33/65 relationship.
  • The microRNA159-regulated GAMYB-like genes inhibit growth and promote programmed cell death in Arabidopsis.
    Alonso-Peral, Plant physiology 2010
    • GeneRIF: MYB33 and MYB65 play no part in gibberellin-mediated growth or flowering in vegetative tissues.
  • The Arabidopsis GAMYB-like genes, MYB33 and MYB65, are microRNA-regulated genes that redundantly facilitate anther development.
    Millar, The Plant cell 2005
    • GeneRIF: Consistent with functional redundancy, promoter-GUS fusions of MYB33 and MYB65 gave identical expression patterns in flowers (sepals, style, receptacle, anther filaments, and connective but not in anthers themselves), shoot apices, and root tips.

XP_010324959 GAMyb-like1 isoform X1 from Solanum lycopersicum (45% identity, 21% coverage)

  • A GAMYB-like gene in tomato and its expression during seed germination.
    Gong, Planta 2008 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: LeGAMYBL1 expression increases during germination, upregulated by gibberellic acid GA(3), declines thereafter. GA(3) not required for expression. abscisic acid does not influence expression. Expression also occurs in the endosperm. [LeGAMYBL1]

NP_001331958 Duplicated homeodomain-like superfamily protein from Arabidopsis thaliana (70% identity, 27% coverage)

  • TRANSPARENT TESTA2 regulates embryonic fatty acid biosynthesis by targeting FUSCA3 during the early developmental stage of Arabidopsis seeds.
    Wang, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2014 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: directly bound to the regulatory region of FUSCA3, and mediates the expression of numerous genes in the fatty acid biosynthesis pathway
  • The effect of transparent TESTA2 on seed fatty acid biosynthesis and tolerance to environmental stresses during young seedling establishment in Arabidopsis.
    Chen, Plant physiology 2012
    • GeneRIF: Loss of TT2 function results in more sufficient fatty acid synthesis.
  • TRANSPARENT TESTA1 interacts with R2R3-MYB factors and affects early and late steps of flavonoid biosynthesis in the endothelium of Arabidopsis thaliana seeds.
    Appelhagen, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2011 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: TT1 (TRANSPARENT TESTA1) interacts with the MYB transcription factor TT2.
  • TTG1 complex MYBs, MYB5 and TT2, control outer seed coat differentiation.
    Gonzalez, Developmental biology 2009 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: AtMYB5 and TT2, as partially redundant in regulating this outer seed coat developmental process with MYB5 having the major role. MYB5 and TT2 are shown to be expressed in this outer seed coat domain.

    Abuqamar, The Plant journal : for cell and molecular biology 2009 (PubMed)
    • GeneRIF: Reduced SlAIM1 gene expression causes an increased susceptibility to fungal disease; ectopic expression of SlAIM1 is sufficient for tolerance to high salinity and oxidative stress.

Q9LDE1 Transcription factor MYB108; Myb-related protein 108; AtMYB108; Protein BOTRYTIS-SUSCEPTIBLE 1 from Arabidopsis thaliana (Mouse-ear cress) (52% identity, 34% coverage) (see paper)
AT3G06490 MYB108 (myb domain protein 108); DNA binding / transcription factor (RefSeq) from Arabidopsis thaliana
NP_187301 myb domain protein 108 from Arabidopsis thaliana

  • FUNCTION: Transcription factor contributing to the regulation of stamen maturation and male fertility in response to jasmonate signaling. Required for correct timing of anther dehiscence. Acts as a negative regulator of abscisic acid-induced cell death. Not involved in the regulation of BOI. Regulated by MYB21 and at a lower level by MYB24. Negatively regulated by the proteasome in an SCF(COI1) E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex-dependent manner.
    SUBUNIT: Interacts with BOI, but not with BRG1.
    DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Reduced male fertility associated with delayed anther dehiscence, reduced pollen viability and decreased fecundity. Increased susceptibility to Botrytis infection. Myb24 and myb108 double mutant has a reduced fertility and a greatly reduced seed set relative to the myb108 parental allele.
